intro: Arjona tuberosa, commonly known as the tuberous arjona, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Arjona tuberosa produces underground tubers, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions with well-drained soil and full sun exposure.
